ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I became much better at academic writing in this course, and I learned a lot thanks to the assigned readings.
This course improved my writing analysis skills and exposed me to a new academic discipline.

This course allowed me to write in a range of styles and context, exposing me to forms of writing beyond the quintessential research essay. 
We also engaged with a range of sources, both academic and vernacular and engaged with workshopping and providing feedback to other students
I learned how to view beauty from a different point of view and appreciate artwork, trends, and culture in a variety of ways.

I learned how to properly structure an argumentative essay and be more persuasive in my writing. I also learned valuable writing tips, such as not always agreeing with sources and sometimes arguing against them.

I learned more about how to write in various formsranging from shorter pieces about art involving my voice to longer research papers. I was taught different techniques when it came to those papers. We also analyzed other writers' styles and identified their claims, key points, and use of evidence. I partook in class discussions about these writings as well.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: The way there are four progressively more challenging papers throughout the semester is great for improving your writing skills. The feedback I received about my writing was generally quite helpful. The only problem I ran into is that some of the deadlines were very tight, especially for papers #3 and #4.

Strengths: instructor feedback and support
Weaknesses: expectations and assignments are sometimes unclear

I think Professor Jones did an amazing job of choosing varied, engaging sources. The course also included visits to the Yale Art Gallery and I really enjoyed engaging with the topic of beauty beyond the four walls of the classroom.

I think the fact that you write a lot of different types of papers is good, however I dont really feel like I was *taught* how to write them. I think we definitely went over ways of engaging with texts and putting them into conversation but it also felt very much like you either knew how to write or didnt.
Also this is a very minor note but sometimes we would get homework due on Monday, on Friday/Saturday as opposed to the Wednesday before when we had our last class of the week. It was rather inconvenient and something I think would be very easy to rectify.
I think this was a well-structured class. The essays we read were interesting and the essay topics allowed for personal thought and experience to be added.

Strengths:
- the professor and her teaching style
- the time given for each paper
- the welcoming class environment 
- the constructive help from peers
- the help from the professor outside of class time, flexible office hours 

Weaknesses:
- the lack of structure in class
- not breaking down the writing steps as I thought the class was meant to do

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes. No matter how good of a writer you are now, you'll get better in this course. And you get to pick a topic that interests you.
I would recommend this course interested to someone interested in beauty and philosophy.

As I havent taken many writing classes at Yale I dont have much to compare it to but I feel like students may be better off taking a different English class such as ENGL 120 on the personal essays or another introductory class.
I think ENGL 114 was good in that I got to practice writing different essays, Im not sure I would take it again in hindsight.
Yes. Ms. Jones pushes her students to improve their writing skills.
Yes I would. I think it was very important to take a writing course in my first semester at Yale, and the topic of beauty was very interesting.

Yes, I would recommend this course to another student. I think I learned a lot, improved my writing, and enjoyed my time while doing so. For an intro writing class, I would highly recommend it. The small setting helped greatly as well.
